TITLE: ESLint Flat Config with Prettier DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration example showing how to use eslint-config-prettier with the new flat config format. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import someConfig from "some-other-config-you-use"; import eslintConfigPrettier from "eslint-config-prettier/flat"; export default [ someConfig, eslintConfigPrettier, ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing eslint-config-prettier Package DESCRIPTION: Various package manager commands to install eslint-config-prettier as a dev dependency. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm i -D eslint-config-prettier ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` yarn add -D eslint-config-prettier ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` pnpm add -D eslint-config-prettier ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` bun add -D eslint-config-prettier ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration with Prettier (eslintrc) DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration example showing how to extend eslint-config-prettier in traditional eslintrc format. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "extends": [ "some-other-config-you-use", "prettier" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing ESLint Config Prettier in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Example showing migration from default import to using the new /flat entry point for flat config users, which adds name property for config-inspector. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // before import eslintConfigPrettier from "eslint-config-prettier"; // after import eslintConfigPrettier from "eslint-config-prettier/flat"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Config with Prettier Extension DESCRIPTION: Example of ESLint configuration JSON showing how to extend Prettier config after version 8.0.0 changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "extends": [ "some-other-config-you-use", "prettier" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Config with Prettier Plugin DESCRIPTION: Example of ESLint configuration using eslint-plugin-prettier with the recommended config. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "extends": [ "some-other-config-you-use", "plugin:prettier/recommended" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Curly Brace Rule in ESLint with Prettier DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the curly brace rule in ESLint to ensure that certain statements are mandated to use curly braces. It also notes potential conflicts with Prettier if the 'multi-line' or 'multi-or-nest' options are used. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "curly": ["error", "all"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - Double Quotes DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures ESLint to enforce the use of double quotes, avoid escaping, and disallow unnecessary template literals. This ensures consistency with Prettier when Prettier is configured to use double quotes. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "quotes": [ "error", "double", { "avoidEscape": true, "allowTemplateLiterals": false } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - Single Quotes DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures ESLint to enforce the use of single quotes, avoid escaping, and disallow unnecessary template literals. This setting needs to be consistent with Prettier's singleQuote option. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "quotes": [ "error", "single", { "avoidEscape": true, "allowTemplateLiterals": false } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Prettier Configuration - Double Quotes (Default) DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures Prettier to use double quotes, which is the default behavior. While explicitly defining this is not required, it's shown here for completeness and clarity, especially when coordinating with ESLint rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "singleQuote": false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Prettier Configuration - Single Quotes DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures Prettier to use single quotes. This configuration should be used in conjunction with the corresponding ESLint rule to ensure consistent code formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "singleQuote": true } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preventing Mixed Operators in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the ESLint configuration for the no-mixed-operators rule, which prevents mixing certain operators, and provides guidance on using it with Prettier. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-mixed-operators": "error" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disallowing Confusing Arrow Functions in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures ESLint to prevent the use of confusing arrow functions. It addresses potential issues with Prettier’s formatting and provides an example configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-confusing-arrow": ["error", { "allowParens": false }] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enforcing Maximum Line Length in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets a maximum line length rule in ESLint to complement Prettier and discusses the need to synchronize options for consistent formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "max-len": ["error", {"code": 80, "ignoreUrls": true}] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - vue/html-self-closing DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures the `vue/html-self-closing` ESLint rule to work with Prettier. Setting `html.void` to "any" ensures consistency by allowing any self-closing style for HTML elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "vue/html-self-closing": [ "error", { "html": { "void": "any" } } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - unicorn/template-indent DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures the `unicorn/template-indent` ESLint rule to avoid conflicts with Prettier. By specifying which tags, functions, selectors, and comments the rule should apply to, it prevents Prettier from formatting the same templates. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "unicorn/template-indent": [ "error", { "tags": [ "outdent", "dedent", "sql", "styled" ], "functions": [ "dedent", "stripIndent" ], "selectors": [], "comments": [ "indent" ] } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - no-restricted-syntax DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures the `no-restricted-syntax` ESLint rule to completely forbid sequence expressions (comma operator). This is an alternative to `no-sequences` to prevent accidental usage of the comma operator. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-restricted-syntax": ["error", "SequenceExpression"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ESLint Configuration - no-restricted-syntax with Message DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet configures the `no-restricted-syntax` ESLint rule to forbid sequence expressions and provides a custom error message. This helps developers understand why the comma operator is disallowed. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-restricted-syntax": [ "error", { "selector": "SequenceExpression", "message": "The comma operator is confusing and a common mistake. Don’t use it!" } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disallowing Tab Characters in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets the no-tabs rule in ESLint to forbid tab characters while allowing flexibility for indentation managed by Prettier. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-tabs": ["error", {"allowIndentationTabs": true}] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preventing Unexpected Multiline Expressions in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the no-unexpected-multiline rule in ESLint to catch potential mistakes in multiline expressions and discusses compatibility with Prettier formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-unexpected-multiline": "error" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Lines Around Comment Rule in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the ESLint configuration for the lines-around-comment rule, which enforces blank lines around comments. It includes considerations for compatibility with Prettier’s formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "lines-around-comment": [ "error", { "beforeBlockComment": true, "afterBlockComment": true, "beforeLineComment": true, "afterLineComment": true, "allowBlockStart": true, "allowBlockEnd": true, "allowObjectStart": true, "allowObjectEnd": true, "allowArrayStart": true, "allowArrayEnd": true } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enforcing Quote Styles in ESLint DESCRIPTION: This configuration for the quotes rule in ESLint allows for enforcing the use of backticks for strings. It also includes an example of the ESLint configuration to achieve this. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "quotes": ["error", "backtick"] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Vue HTML Self-Closing Example DESCRIPTION: This Vue.js code snippet illustrates how Prettier handles self-closing tags. Prettier preserves the original style for regular components but always uses the self-closing style for known void HTML elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Flat Config Plugin Example DESCRIPTION: Example showing plugin naming in flat config format and potential pitfalls with non-standard names. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import typescriptEslint from "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin"; import eslintConfigPrettier from "eslint-config-prettier/flat"; export default [ { plugins: { ts: typescriptEslint, }, rules: { "ts/indent": "error", }, }, eslintConfigPrettier, ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Test File Example for Contributing DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet demonstrates the structure of a test file (`test-lint/foobar.js`) for contributing to `eslint-config-prettier`. The test should fail when eslint-plugin-foobar and eslint-plugin-prettier are used together, until `eslint-config-prettier` is added to the ESLint config. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` /* eslint-disable quotes */ "use strict"; // Prettier does not want spaces before the parentheses, but // `plugin:foobar/recommended` wants one. console.log(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Example for Contributing - ESLint Rule Off DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet demonstrates how to disable a specific ESLint rule (e.g., `foobar/some-rule`) in `index.js` when contributing to `eslint-config-prettier`. Setting the rule to "off" ensures that Prettier's formatting is not overridden by the ESLint plugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` "foobar/some-rule": "off" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Array Example DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how ESLint and Prettier interact with backticks in JavaScript arrays. The first element illustrates where quotes could be used instead of backticks, while the remaining elements show valid use cases for backticks. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` const strings = [ `could have been a regular string`, ` multiple lines `, `uses ${interpolation}`, String.raw`\tagged/`, ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Ternary Example with HTML DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet demonstrates a ternary expression containing an HTML template literal. It highlights potential conflicts between Prettier and `unicorn/template-indent` regarding indentation within template literals. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` condition ? null : html`

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam in dui mauris.

`; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Matrix Example with Parentheses DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet demonstrates how Prettier automatically adds parentheses to sequence expressions, making them explicit. This example uses the comma operator (sequence expression). SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` matrix[(4, 7)]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Matrix Example DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet shows an example of using the comma operator (sequence expression) which can be confusing. Prettier adds parentheses to clarify its use. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` matrix[4, 7]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring no-confusing-arrow Rule in ESLint DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure the no-confusing-arrow rule in ESLint to work with Prettier v6.0.0 and above by explicitly setting allowParens to false. SOURCE: https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-confusing-arrow": ["error"] } } ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "rules": { "no-confusing-arrow": ["error", { "allowParens": false }] } } ```
